ags:resource.dc:title: Produktivitas tanaman pakan Indigofera sp. pada tingkat cekaman kekeringan dan interval pemangkasan berbeda

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Productivity of Indigofera sp. at different drought stress level and defoliations interval

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: This study was aimed at determining the interaction between drought stress and defoliation interval on the production of Indigofera sp. This study was done based on complete randomized design (CRD) 3 x 2 factorial, the first factor was without drought stress (100 percent FC), medium drought stress (50 percent FC), and severe drought stress (25 percent FC), and the second factor was the defoliation interval of 60 day 5 and 90 days, each treatment was repeated 5 times. Observed variables were biomass production and leaf/stem ratio. Results showed that there were significant interactions (P < 0.05) between drought stress and defoliations interval on the productivity of Indigofera sp. The highest biomass production of Indigofera sp. (424.47 g/plant) was obtained from treatment of without drought stress (100 percent FC) combined with defoliations interval of 90 days, while the lowest (184.55 g/plant) was reached at treatment of severe drought stress (25 percent FC) and depoliations interval of 60 days. The highest leaf/stem ratio (1.47) was reached at treatment severe drought stress (25 percent FC) and defoliation interval of 60 days and the lowest (1.05) was reached at combination treatment of drought stress and defoliations interval of 90 day as. Defoliation interval of 90 days showed higher biomass production that defoliations of 60 days.
